cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.current_location: about 80 mi NNW of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northeast, cross the southern and central Florida Peninsula on Saturday, then accelerate northeastward into the Atlantic toward the Carolinas and eventually toward Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-west Florida Peninsula near the Naples / Marco Island area

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County Line (includes Port Canaveral), west coast south of the Middle of Longboat Key, Keys, Lake Okeechobee, and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and central Florida Peninsula, including east-central Florida coastline from Cape Canaveral southward and west coast from Longboat Key to Florida Bay
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible, but totals more likely 2–4 inches at Port Canaveral
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph, isolated 45 mph) possible Saturday as the center crosses the peninsula
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected on the Atlantic side; any rise likely less than 1 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Saturday could total 2–4 inches with localized ponding and minor urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and dangerous rip currents along adjacent beaches; lightning within squalls
